conversations.question: What is Kevin Manson's current position?
conversations.answer: He is a Senior Fullstack Developer at Qohash in Canada since August 2021.

conversations.question: Which technologies does Kevin master in frontend and mobile development?
conversations.answer: He is proficient in React, React-Native, AngularJS, and Ionic for frontend and mobile development.

conversations.question: What skills does Kevin have for backend development and database management?
conversations.answer: He is experienced in NodeJS, GraphQL, Java, Kotlin, and Hapi, and works with SQL and MongoDB for database management.

conversations.question: Which tools and practices does he use for code management and deployments?
conversations.answer: He uses Git, Docker, Terraform, and CI/CD tools to ensure continuous integration and deployment.

conversations.question: What is Kevin's experience at Qohash?
conversations.answer: At Qohash, he developed a web platform for data security using React, GraphQL, and Kotlin, translated the platform into French using generative AI, and created a UI library for the company's products.

conversations.question: What role did Kevin play at GoTo / Team Messaging?
conversations.answer: He worked as a Software Engineer, contributing to the development of features for instant messaging (SMS/Web) on both web and mobile platforms using React-Native.

conversations.question: What notable achievements did Kevin accomplish at XpertSea?
conversations.answer: He created a mobile application in React-Native integrating digital vision models and developed a dedicated NodeJS backend for mobile applications.

conversations.question: What type of projects did he lead as a Fullstack Developer Consultant in France?
conversations.answer: He developed web applications for sales and inventory management at Brittany Ferries, Android applications focused on mobile security, and CRM tools for Crédit Mutual Arkéa and B&B Hotels, while leading teams and contributing to the overhaul of information systems.

conversations.question: Which languages does Kevin Manson speak?
conversations.answer: He speaks French and English.

conversations.question: Where is Kevin Manson based?
conversations.answer: He is based in Québec, QC, Canada.

conversations.question: What is Kevin Manson's name and professional title?
conversations.answer: Kevin Manson, Fullstack Developer.

conversations.answer: He primarily uses JavaScript and TypeScript.

conversations.question: Which tools and methodologies does Kevin master for project management and CI/CD pipelines?
conversations.answer: He masters Git, Docker, Terraform, CI/CD, as well as pipeline management. He also has knowledge in DevOps and microservices.

conversations.question: Which languages does Kevin Manson speak?
conversations.answer: He speaks French and English.

conversations.question: What are the key achievements of Kevin at Qohash?
conversations.answer: At Qohash, as a Senior Fullstack Developer (August 2021 – Present, Canada), he developed a web platform for data security using React, GraphQL, and Kotlin, translated the platform into French using generative AI, and created/maintained a UI library for all the company's products, including the associated documentation.

conversations.question: What role did Kevin play at GoTo / Team Messaging?
conversations.answer: He worked as a Software Engineer (February 2021 – August 2021, Canada), contributing to the development of instant messaging features (SMS/Web) on both web and mobile platforms using React-Native.

conversations.question: What were Kevin's responsibilities at XpertSea?
conversations.answer: As a Senior Frontend Developer / Lead (September 2018 – February 2021, Canada), he designed a mobile application using React-Native with the integration of digital vision models, and developed a dedicated NodeJS backend for mobile applications.

conversations.question: What did Kevin's role at Celliers Intelligents involve?
conversations.answer: As a Senior Fullstack Developer / DevOps (September 2018 – August 2019, Canada), he developed and maintained both frontend and backend applications (AngularJS, Ionic, NodeJS, Hapi) and managed continuous integration and deployment processes via GitLab and AWS.

conversations.question: What projects did Kevin work on at OVH?
conversations.answer: At OVH (October 2016 – July 2018, Canada), as a Senior Frontend Developer, he developed and maintained the client application using AngularJS, created a set of UI components to standardize the application, developed and maintained microservices in NodeJS, and participated in discussions on technological transitions.

conversations.question: What experiences did Kevin gain as a Fullstack Developer Consultant in France?
conversations.answer: From September 2009 to September 2016, he worked on several projects: For Brittany Ferries, he developed a web application for sales and inventory management and led a team of 10 developers on a full-stack project (Java, Node.js, AngularJS). For Crédit Mutual Arkéa, he developed Android applications focused on mobile security, conducted R&D in authentication (fingerprint, voice and ocular recognition), and designed a CRM tool in Java. For B&B Hotels, he developed a complete CRM tool in Java, contributed to the overhaul of the information system, maintained the system using technologies such as Perl, PHP, Bash, and Java, created new internal web tools in JavaScript, and managed a GSM module for sending reservation confirmations.

conversations.question: What is Kevin's approach to ensuring platform localization at Qohash?
conversations.answer: He translated the web platform into French using generative AI.

conversations.question: Which project did Kevin lead for Brittany Ferries during his consultancy?
conversations.answer: He developed a web application for sales and inventory management and led a team of 10 developers on a full-stack project.

conversations.question: How did Kevin contribute to mobile security projects at Crédit Mutual Arkéa?
conversations.answer: He developed Android applications focused on mobile security and conducted R&D on authentication methods such as fingerprint, voice, and ocular recognition.

conversations.question: What significant achievement did Kevin accomplish at OVH?
conversations.answer: He developed and maintained the client application using AngularJS, created a set of standardized UI components, and developed microservices in NodeJS.

conversations.question: Which CI/CD tools and practices did Kevin utilize at Celliers Intelligents?
conversations.answer: He managed continuous integration and deployment processes using GitLab and AWS.
